original_solution_mapping.L1: By the first two months, 20/100*200 = <<20/100*200=40>>40 mountains had erupted.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is 200-40= <<200-40=160>>160
original_solution_mapping.L3: When 40% of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by 40/100*160 = <<40/100*160=64>>64
original_solution_mapping.L4: The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is 160-64 = <<160-64=96>>96
original_solution_mapping.L5: When 50% of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by 50/100*96 = <<50/100*96=48>>48
original_solution_mapping.L6: At the end of the year, 96-48 = <<96-48=48>>48 mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2109.
    Returns: the number of mountains still intact at the end of the year.
    """
    # L1
    erupted_percentage_first_phase = Fraction(20, 100) # 20% of the volcanoes exploded
    total_volcanoes = 200 # 200 active volcanoes
    erupted_first_phase = erupted_percentage_first_phase * total_volcanoes

    # L2
    remaining_after_first_phase = total_volcanoes - erupted_first_phase

    # L3
    erupted_percentage_second_phase = Fraction(40, 100) # 40% of the remaining exploded
    erupted_second_phase = erupted_percentage_second_phase * remaining_after_first_phase

    # L4
    remaining_after_second_phase = remaining_after_first_phase - erupted_second_phase

    # L5
    erupted_percentage_third_phase = Fraction(50, 100) # another 50% of the volcanoes that hadn't already erupted also exploded
    erupted_third_phase = erupted_percentage_third_phase * remaining_after_second_phase

    # L6
    mountains_intact_end_year = remaining_after_second_phase - erupted_third_phase

    # FA
    answer = mountains_intact_end_year
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: By the first two months, {erupted_percentage_first_phase}*{total_volcanoes} = <<{erupted_percentage_first_phase}*{total_volcanoes}={erupted_first_phase}>>{erupted_first_phase} mountains had erupted.

The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is {total_volcanoes}-{erupted_first_phase}= <<{total_volcanoes}-{erupted_first_phase}={remaining_after_first_phase}>>{remaining_after_first_phase}

When {erupted_percentage_second_phase} of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by {erupted_percentage_second_phase}*{remaining_after_first_phase} = <<{erupted_percentage_second_phase}*{remaining_after_first_phase}={erupted_second_phase}>>{erupted_second_phase}

The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is {remaining_after_first_phase}-{erupted_second_phase} = <<{remaining_after_first_phase}-{erupted_second_phase}={remaining_after_second_phase}>>{remaining_after_second_phase}

When {erupted_percentage_third_phase} of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by {erupted_percentage_third_phase}*{remaining_after_second_phase} = <<{erupted_percentage_third_phase}*{remaining_after_second_phase}={erupted_third_phase}>>{erupted_third_phase}

At the end of the year, {remaining_after_second_phase}-{erupted_third_phase} = <<{remaining_after_second_phase}-{erupted_third_phase}={mountains_intact_end_year}>>{mountains_intact_end_year} mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.
